skill.name: siteground-cache
skill.description: Bypass SiteGround caching (SG CachePress + LiteSpeed) for WordPress development. Adds cache-busting code to child themes for real-time development testing.
skill.summary: Bypass SiteGround caching (SG CachePress + LiteSpeed) for WordPress development. Adds cache-busting ...
skill.author: CrazySwami

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate WordPress development tool. The skill injects PHP code into child themes to disable caching during development. The static scanner flagged 55 patterns but all are false positives: shell commands are standard bash scripting (path resolution, date commands for backups), hardcoded URLs are example placeholders (ftp.example.com), and weak crypto alerts are triggered by documentation text patterns. The SKILL.md explicitly enforces staging-only deployments with production path blocking.

content.value_statement: SiteGround caching can delay CSS and JS changes during development. This skill adds cache-busting code to child themes for instant feedback. Perfect for WordPress developers working with SG CachePress or LiteSpeed Cache.
actual_capabilities: Inject cache-busting PHP code into child themes
Disable LiteSpeed Cache for administrator users
Disable SG CachePress for administrator users
Add timestamp versioning to CSS and JS asset URLs
Display development mode banner showing theme version
limitations: Code must be removed before deploying to production
Only works on staging or local development environments
Requires write access to child theme functions.php file

faq.question: Which WordPress versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with WordPress 5.0 and newer. Requires a child theme with a functions.php file.

faq.question: What are the resource limits?
faq.answer: No specific limits. The PHP code adds small constants and filters that have minimal performance impact.

faq.question: Does this integrate with other plugins?
faq.answer: Yes. It disables caching for LiteSpeed Cache and SG Optimizer plugins specifically. Other caching may still apply.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only modifies local theme files. No external network calls are made by the PHP code.

faq.question: The banner is not showing. What do I do?
faq.answer: Verify you are logged in as an administrator. Check that the child theme is activated. Clear your browser cache.

faq.question: How is this different from other cache plugins?
faq.answer: This tool disables caching only for logged-in administrators. Production visitors still get cached pages for optimal performance.
